message.content:
cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.CR 

The paper discusses the importance of the width of a feedforward neural network in producing connected or disconnected decision regions. This topic is closely related to machine learning and neural networks, which are covered by several arXiv CS sub-categories. "cs.LG" (Machine Learning) is the most likely category as the paper deals with the fundamental aspects of neural network design. "cs.NE" (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is also a likely category as the paper discusses the structure of neural networks. "cs.CV" (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) and "cs.AI" (Artificial Intelligence) are also possible categories as the paper discusses the implications of the results for the construction of neural networks and the problem of adversarial manipulation of classifiers. Finally, "cs.CR" (Cryptography and Security) is a less likely category as the paper briefly mentions the problem of adversarial manipulation of classifiers.
